title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: India's Rise as a Smartphone Manufacturing Hub
items.summary:
- *India* has become the world's **third-largest** exporter of mobile phones, surpassing China, with exports worth *$20.5 billion* in 2024. 
- The surge is driven by *Make in India*, Apple's increased production, and US importers frontloading inventory due to tariff uncertainties. 
- The country now hosts over *300 manufacturing units*, with a *99.2%* share of locally-made phones, boosting domestic production and global supply chain participation.

items.title: Acer Expands Contract Manufacturing in Puducherry & Tamil Nadu
items.summary:
- *Acer is increasing its contract manufacturing capacity* in Puducherry and Tamil Nadu.
- The company, working with Puducherry's Plumage, plans to build a larger setup capable of producing *up to 2 lakh laptops annually*.
- *Export opportunities* are also being explored in Southeast Asia, leveraging India-made products for markets like the Philippines and Thailand.

**Key points include expansion plans, increased production capabilities, and export strategies that aim to strengthen Acer's footprint in India and beyond.**

items.title: Cybercrime Wave Hits Canada with 12 Billion Attacks in 2025
items.summary:
- Canada experienced an *unprecedented surge* in cyberattacks, with over *12 billion malicious attempts* in the first half of 2025.
- Cybercriminals are increasingly using the *crime-as-a-service* model, making attacks faster, more sophisticated, and often automated.
- *Artificial intelligence* is vital for cybersecurity, helping to triage threats, automate responses, and prevent system breaches amid rising threats targeting critical infrastructure and IoT devices.

items.title: Alpex Solar to expand capacity in Mathura
India hits 100 GW solar PV capacity
items.summary:
*India's solar manufacturing capacity has surged from 2.3 GW in 2014 to 100 GW in 2025, marking a fourfold increase in recent years.*
- *This milestone, celebrated by Prime Minister Modi, highlights India’s progress towards *self-reliance* in clean energy and manufacturing.*
- *Despite excess capacity compared to current demand, this growth strengthens India’s climate targets and global supply chain role.*

items.title: Singapore's Thakral Corp to produce drone parts in India
items.summary:
- *Thakral Corp* aims to expand its *B2B arm, Bharat Skytech*, to produce *drone components* in India, supporting the *local manufacturing ecosystem*.
- The group is also exploring *manufacturing enterprise drones* and benefiting from the rising adoption in markets like *Sri Lanka* and *Bangladesh*.
- *Strategic investments* in real estate and lifestyle businesses, along with diversification into *drone solutions*, position Thakral for *long-term growth* in India and the region.

items.title: Oracle lays off over 150 jobs amid AI spending surge
Chinese PC maker Lenovo says US-China tariff pause a positive sign
Celcius Logistics invests ₹50 crore in pharma cold chain
items.summary:
- *Celcius Logistics* launches Celcius+, a dedicated *pharma cold supply chain* segment.
- The initial investment of ₹50 crore aims to build a **specialized fleet** and infrastructure, targeting ₹100 crore ARR within 18 months.
- The company plans to deploy 100 reefer vehicles and expand support teams to ensure **temperature-controlled, compliant delivery** of medicines and vaccines, bridging gaps in pharma distribution.

items.title: Tata Steel Q1 profits rise via cost cuts despite revenue dip
items.summary:
- *Tata Steel* boosted Q1 profits through *cost reductions* and operational efficiencies.
- Despite a 3% decline in *revenue*, EBITDA increased 10%, driven by *raw material cost savings* and higher *realizations*.
- The company is optimistic about *demand recovery* fueled by *festive season* and *monsoon effects*, with ongoing *cost-saving* initiatives aiming for ₹11,500 crore savings in FY26.

items.title: India’s per capita steel consumption crosses 100 kg
items.summary:
- *India's* domestic per capita steel use has *surpassed 100 kg*, marking a significant milestone.
- The government’s *National Steel Policy 2017* aims to increase this to *160 kg* by 2030-31.
- Despite global declines, India’s *steel industry* has experienced robust *12% growth* in production.

items.title: China's solar power capacity growth to slow in H2 after pricing reforms
BPCL Q1 net profit jumps 141%
items.summary:
- *BPCL* reported a **net profit of ₹6,839 crore**, a **141% increase** year-on-year in Q1 FY26.
- Revenue grew slightly by 1%, while **expenses decreased by 2%**, boosting profitability.
- The company's *operating margin* improved significantly to **6.32%** from 2.68%, driven by better cost management and higher EBITDA.

**Scores**: { "scale": 8, "impact": 7, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 7 } 
**Keywords**: [BPCL, profit, financial results, EBITDA, margins, energy]

items.title: Vedanta Aluminium aims for global billet leadership
items.summary:
- *Vedanta Aluminium* is expanding its capacity to become the world's largest billet producer, targeting 1.2 million tonnes per year.
- The company is innovating in *sustainable aluminium products*, focusing on low-carbon, recycled, and value-added offerings.
- Vedanta aims to support *high-growth sectors* like EVs, renewable energy, and aerospace, aligning with India's 'Make in India' and 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' initiatives.

items.title: India to Allow Private Firms to Mine and Import Uranium
items.summary:
- *India plans to permit private companies to mine, import, and process uranium*, ending a longstanding state monopoly in the nuclear sector.
- The move aims to support *India's nuclear expansion*, targeting a 12-fold increase in capacity by 2047, with nuclear power expected to contribute 5% of the total energy.
- *Domestic uranium resources are insufficient* to meet future demand, prompting reliance on imports and regulatory reforms involving amendments to five laws, despite current restrictions on private sector involvement.

**Keywords:** India uranium mining policy, nuclear expansion, private firms, foreign investment, nuclear power

items.title: GAIL and TruAlt Bioenergy form joint venture in India
items.summary:
- *GAIL* and *TruAlt Bioenergy* have announced a strategic *joint venture* to develop India's *compressed biogas (CBG)* sector.
- The partnership involves **setting up six new greenfield CBG plants** using agricultural residues, aiming to produce nearly **24,000 tonnes of CBG annually**.
- This initiative is expected to create **jobs**, promote rural development, reduce **fossil fuel consumption**, and **cut methane emissions**, fostering a *decentralized*, *circular energy economy*.

items.title: Omega Seiki invests $25M in Dubai EV plant
items.summary:
- *Omega Seiki Mobility* (OSM), an Indian electric vehicle manufacturer, will establish its *first overseas EV assembly plant* in Dubai's Jebel Ali Free Zone with a $25 million investment.
- The *42,000 sq ft plant* will start operations by end-2025, producing electric *two- and three-wheelers* and facilitating export markets across the Middle East and Africa.
- The project aims to leverage Dubai's strategic location for *sustainable mobility solutions* and also includes plans for *CNG-powered models* in African markets, enhancing *clean energy transportation* options.

items.title: Saint-Gobain expands manufacturing footprint in India with new facilities in Chennai
items.summary:
*Saint-Gobain is constructing its largest multi-business hub in India near Chennai, featuring facilities for float glass, insulation, and building materials.*
- The new float glass line will produce 1,000 tonnes per day, emphasizing energy efficiency and digital integration.
- The company also plans a large mineral wool insulation plant, designed as a near net-zero carbon facility, to meet India's growing construction demands.

**These investments will significantly enhance Saint-Gobain's local production capacity and sustainability efforts.**

items.title: Jeena & Company partners with Salesforce for AI-led digital transformation
items.summary:
- *Jeena & Company*, a logistics firm, is collaborating with *Salesforce* to accelerate its *digital transformation* using *AI-enabled workflows*.
- The initial step involves implementing *Salesforce Sales Cloud* to enhance *sales visibility* and streamline *client engagement*.
- This move shifts the company from *legacy systems* to *AI-driven operations*, aiming to improve *decision-making*, *transparency*, and *customer experience*.

items.title: Setco Automotive Q1 revenue up 7.8% to ₹178.8 crore
L&T and ITOCHU Collaborate on Green Ammonia in Gujarat
items.summary:
- *L&T* and *ITOCHU Corporation* have partnered to develop a *green ammonia* facility in Kandla, Gujarat, with a capacity of 300 KTPA.
- The project aims to produce *zero-emission fuel* for the *maritime industry*, particularly for bunkering in Singapore, supporting *decarbonisation* goals.
- This initiative builds on L&T’s previous investments in *green hydrogen and ammonia*, positioning Gujarat as a key hub for *sustainable fuel production*.

items.title: ACME Hybrid Urja secures ₹3,184 crore funding from REC
items.summary:
*ACME Hybrid Urja*, a subsidiary of ACME Solar, has secured ₹3,184 crore in *long-term project financing* from **REC Ltd** for a **280 MW hybrid renewable energy project**. 
- The project features *solar and battery energy storage technologies*, aiming to ensure *reliable, dispatchable power* and contribute to India’s *energy transition goals*. 
- With a 25-year *power purchase agreement* at ₹4.64 per unit, the project is designed to achieve high *capacity utilization* and support *grid stability* while reducing *greenhouse gas emissions*.

items.title: Calcom Vision Q1 FY26 profit soars 138.72%
items.summary:
- *Calcom Vision* reported a **138.72% increase** in profit after tax to ₹69 lakh in Q1 FY26, reversing last year's loss.
- Revenue grew **146.82%** year-on-year to ₹45.07 crore, supported by demand across product lines and operational efficiency.
- *Chairman Sushil Kumar Malik* highlighted strong performance driven by strategic expansion, exports, and focus on high-value segments.

items.title: PTC Industries, Kineco Aerospace & Defence MoU for Advanced Components
items.summary:
- *PTC Industries* and *Kineco Aerospace & Defence* signed an MoU to co-develop *aerospace components* and structural assemblies.
- They will focus on *hybrid aero structures*, **localising critical flight components**, and joint R&D with organizations like DRDO.
- The partnership aims to create a *self-reliant Indian aerospace ecosystem* by leveraging expertise in *metals and composites* for civil and defence sectors.

items.title: Thermax partners Norway’s HydrogenPro for green hydrogen in India
items.summary:
- **Thermax** partners with **HydrogenPro** to localise **alkaline electrolysis technology** for large-scale *green hydrogen projects* in India.
- The collaboration involves **technology licensing**, **stack supply**, and **local manufacturing**, aiming to expand India's *green hydrogen ecosystem*.
- This partnership allows **Thermax** to deliver **integrated electrolyser solutions** with technical support, fostering **decarbonisation** and *sustainable energy* initiatives.

**Scores:** {"scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8}
**Keywords:** ["green hydrogen", "Thermax", "HydrogenPro", "electrolyser technology", "decarbonisation", "India energy"]

items.title: How Mahindra Auto scales AI from factory to customer
items.summary: *Mahindra Auto* integrates AI extensively across its operations, from smart factories and predictive maintenance to customer engagement.* AI-powered systems improve quality, safety, and efficiency on the shop floor.* The company's AI platform MAIA enhances vehicle safety and supports sustainability, while strong governance ensures responsible AI usage.

items.title: Karnataka manufacturers face tariff hike threats
items.summary: *Karnataka's manufacturing sector is worried about a potential *electricity tariff increase*.* The Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission (KERC) has partially approved petitions from Escoms to revise tariffs, including among industries.* Industry groups threaten to challenge the hikes, which could lead to closures or higher consumer prices.*Escoms also seek to extend *green tariffs* for small consumers to promote renewable energy.

items.title: Manufacturing sectors brace for impact of 50% tariff
Thermax partners with HydrogenPro for green hydrogen in India
items.summary:
- *Thermax* has partnered with *HydrogenPro* to localize *alkaline electrolysis* technology for **large-scale green hydrogen projects** in India.
- The collaboration grants Thermax exclusive rights for supply, installation, and support, with technology transfer and local manufacturing to begin immediately.
- The move aims to enable *decarbonization* across industries by providing **state-of-the-art, locally-produced alkaline electrolyzers** with complete lifecycle support, leveraging HydrogenPro's tech and Thermax's execution expertise.

items.title: Tariffs challenge India's US exports: Crisil
items.summary: *India Inc* faces **unviable export conditions** to the US due to an **additional 25% tariff** imposed on Indian goods.* Sectors like diamond polishing, shrimp, textiles, and chemicals are **at risk of declining earnings**.* The impact varies based on **trade exposure, cost-absorption capacity**, and **bilateral trade negotiations**, with the potential for **global trade shifts** and **economic repercussions**.*

items.title: OnePlus partners with Bhagwati for local tablet manufacturing in India
items.summary:
*OnePlus* has partnered with *Bhagwati Products* to locally manufacture premium tablets in India, including the **OnePlus Pad 3** and **Pad Lite**.

- The partnership supports *local manufacturing* and aligns with OnePlus' *Project Starlight* initiative.
- Production takes place at Bhagwati's Greater Noida facility, emphasizing *India's manufacturing capability*.
- The collaboration aims to strengthen *India's ecosystem* and demonstrates OnePlus' commitment to expand its *connected ecosystem* in the country.

items.title: Zetwerk acquires majority stake in KRYFS Power Components
items.summary:
- *Zetwerk*, a *digital manufacturing platform*, has acquired **control** of *KRYFS Power Components*, a leader in *transformer solutions*.
- The partnership aims to **enhance** *digital quality traceability* and expand offerings like *CNC parts, solar modules,* and *smart transformer monitoring*.
- *Market prospects* are strong with India’s power infrastructure investment reach of **$330 billion by 2030** and *transformer market* expected to **double** to **$4.2 billion**.

**Scores:** {"scale": 7, "impact": 8, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8} **|** **Keywords:** ["Zetwerk", "KRYFS Power Components", "transformer solutions", "energy transition", "digital manufacturing"]

items.title: Jindal Steel's Profit Rises 12% in June Quarter
items.summary: *Jindal Steel and Power* reported a **12% increase** in net profit to Rs 1,496 crore in June, despite a >9% decline in revenue to Rs 14,336 crore.* The company improved *EBITDA* to Rs 2,984 crore, with *per tonne earnings* rising to Rs 15,680.* Its net debt increased to Rs 14,400 crore, and it is nearing the final stages of a new plant in Odisha. The company's stocks rose slightly, reflecting positive earnings despite lower revenue.

items.title: MAN Industries Q1 Net Profit Up 45% to ₹27.6 Cr
items.summary:
- *MAN Industries* reported a **45% increase** in *net profit* to ₹27.6 crore in Q1 FY26, driven by **operational efficiency** and favorable product-mix.
- Consolidated revenue was **₹742 crore**, nearly stable, with **operating margin** expanding to 10.4%. 
- The company is expanding **its global footprint** with greenfield projects in Saudi Arabia and Jammu, supported by a **₹3,200 crore order book** and a strong pipeline of ~₹15,000 crore.

items.title: Toyota to build new factory in Aichi, Japan
items.summary:
*Toyota will establish a new vehicle manufacturing plant in Aichi Prefecture, Japan, with operations starting early 2030s.*
- The plant aims to support Toyota's goal of maintaining 3 million vehicles produced domestically annually, integrating advanced technology.
- The development involves collaboration with local stakeholders, emphasizing innovation and community inclusion.*

**Scores:** {"scale": 6, "impact": 7, "novelty": 6, "longTermSignificance": 8}
**Keywords:** ["Toyota", "Aichi Prefecture", "vehicle manufacturing", "automation", "local collaboration"]

items.title: Sneaker brand On raises sales forecast as promotions drive demand
items.summary:
- *On Holding* boosted its **annual sales forecast** due to strong demand driven by *brand promotion* efforts.
- The company has gained market share in the U.S. by targeting *younger consumers* through collaborations, innovation, and expanding its direct sales channels.
- Despite challenges like a 40% tariff on imports, *sales increased 32%* in Q2, though it posted a small loss partly due to currency effects, reaffirming its growth trajectory and premium branding strategy.

items.title: Hubbell to acquire DMC Power for $825M
items.summary:
- *Hubbell* will acquire *DMC Power* for **$825 million** to expand its *critical components* portfolio.
- The acquisition focuses on DMC's *high-voltage connector technology*, aligning with increased demand for *power infrastructure* driven by *data centers* and *AI*.
- The purchase is expected to boost Hubbell's *market presence* in *power substation* and *transmission markets*, with closing anticipated by year's end.

items.title: Unplugged to Assemble Privacy Phones in Nevada
items.summary:
- *Unplugged* will start assembling its privacy-focused *UP Phone* in Nevada this fall, marking a strategic move toward *domestic manufacturing* in the US.
- The company aims to keep the device under $1,000 despite high labor costs, with plans to gradually source more components locally.
- The device includes features like *firewall-based tracker blocking*, *encrypted photo storage*, and VPN services, with new software upgrades and interface improvements. **This move aligns with US efforts to boost local tech production.**

items.title: Casio India starts sale of locally manufactured watches
OnePlus to Manufacture Premium Tablets in India
items.summary:
- **OnePlus** collaborates with **Bhagwati Products Ltd** to produce premium tablets in India, boosting the *Make in India* initiative.
- The partnership involves local manufacturing at BPL's Greater Noida facility, aligning with *Project Starlight* and India’s goal to become a *global technology hub*.
- This move highlights India’s rapid growth in electronics manufacturing, with over 300 mobile units and a near-complete domestic production of mobile phones.

items.title: Qualcomm localising module production in India, supporting partners' manufacturing plans
items.summary:
*Qualcomm is localising *automotive module production* in *India*, focusing on supporting local ecosystem partners.*
- The company is investing in India to shift manufacturing of chips and modules, primarily for *automotive* and *electric vehicle* applications.*
- Qualcomm aims to build *local products* tailored to Indian market needs, enhancing *competitive advantage* and contributing to its goal of doubling *automotive revenue* to $8 billion by 2029.*

items.title: Taiwan Excellence showcases smart manufacturing solutions at Automation Expo India 2025
Hindalco reports 30% rise in Q1 net profit
items.summary:
- *Hindalco Industries* reported a **30% increase** in its **consolidated net profit** for Q1 FY26, reaching ₹4,004 crore.
- Revenue also grew by **13%** to ₹64,232 crore, driven by robust performance in *India* and its subsidiary *Novelis*.
- The company's *upstream aluminium* segment and downstream operations showed record EBITDA, with a focus on **operational efficiencies** and **cost control**.

items.title: Vedanta Aluminium moves over 55 million tonnes of cargo in FY25
items.summary:
- *Vedanta Aluminium* transported more than **55 million tonnes** of raw materials and products in FY25 via its extensive *logistics network*. 
- Its operations include moving *alumina*, *coal*, and exporting to over **100 destinations** across six continents, with a significant focus on *sustainability* and *digitalization*. 
- The company is a *leader* in India’s aluminium sector, producing 2.42 million tonnes in FY25 and emphasizing *environmental* and *technological innovations* such as electric forklifts and digital supply chain systems.

items.title: Cabinet approves four semiconductor units in India
items.summary: *The Indian Cabinet has approved four new *semiconductor manufacturing* units across Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, and Punjab, with a total investment of ₹4,594 crore.* *These projects include the country's first commercial *compound fab* and advanced packaging units.* *This move aims to significantly boost India’s semiconductor ecosystem and technological self-reliance.*

items.title: Hindustan Zinc joins International Council on Mining and Metals
items.summary:
- **Hindustan Zinc** becomes the *first Indian company* to join the **International Council on Mining and Metals (ICMM)**, a global organization focused on *sustainable development* and *responsible mining practices*.
- The company's membership, endorsed after an independent review, includes a commitment to meet ICMM's *40 environmental, social, and governance standards*, validated by third-party assessments.
- ICMM President Rohitesh Dhawan emphasizes that this milestone will **strengthen regional engagement** and promotes *collaboration* for safer, more responsible mining practices in India and beyond.

items.title: Titagarh Rail Systems to form naval subsidiary; reports ₹42.75 crore Q1 net profit
items.summary:
*Titagarh Rail Systems will create a wholly owned subsidiary, Titagarh Naval Systems Private Limited (TNSPL), to focus on *Shipbuilding and Maritime Systems*. 
- In Q1 2025, the company reported a *net profit* of ₹42.75 crore from a revenue of ₹679.30 crore, with *freight rail* contributing the majority.
- The move aims to streamline core rail operations while expanding the *maritime segment* through strategic partnerships and focused development.*

items.title: NLC India and BARC to Extract Rare Earth Elements from Fly Ash
items.summary:
*NLC India Limited (NLCIL)* and *BARC* have signed an MoU to develop a process for extracting *rare earth elements (REEs)* from *fly ash*, a by-product of thermal power generation.
- A *pilot project* will be established at Neyveli to demonstrate this extraction, aiming to improve *fly ash management* and reduce dependence on imports of critical materials.
- The initiative supports *sustainable resource use*, *self-reliance*, and aligns with *government* goals for strategic mineral security and environmental responsibility.

items.title: Cactus partners leads $7 million funding round in Brandworks Technologies
Semiconductors Cost Nvidia, AMD in US-China Tech War
items.summary:
- US semiconductor giants *Nvidia* and *AMD* will pay 15% revenue tax on AI chips sold to China, impacting their profits.
- The chips, *H20* from Nvidia and *MI308* from AMD, are **AI accelerators** developed for the Chinese market, crucial for advancing AI capabilities.
- China's distrust grows as it questions the security and environmental safety of these chips, amid ongoing US-China semiconductor tensions and policy shifts.
